vega.uplink.commanding

Class Mib

  • java.lang.Object
    • CompositeDataset
      • vega.uplink.commanding.Mib

  • public class Mib
extends CompositeDataset
    The MIB to be used. It only contains the tables from the MIB relevant for mission planning The tables read are SDF, CSP, CDF, CPC and CSS

    • Method Detail

      • getMibFromFiles

        public static Mib getMibFromFiles()
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Read the MIB from files. The location will be read from the properties
        Returns:
        the MIB
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In the case the files are not found or are not readable

      • getMibFromJar

        public static Mib getMibFromJar()
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Read the MIB from the jars in the class path. The need to be in a directory called mib in the first level of the class path
        Returns:
        The MIB
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - IN case that the directory mib is not found in the class path

      • checkSequence

        public boolean checkSequence(java.lang.String sequence)
        Check if a sequence exist in the MIB
        Parameters:
        sequence - The sequence name to be checked
        Returns:
        True if the sequence exist and false otherwise

      • checkParameterSequence

        public boolean checkParameterSequence(java.lang.String sequence,
                             java.lang.String parameter)
        Check if a particular sequence has a given parameter defined in the MIB or not
        Parameters:
        sequence - Sequence name
        parameter - Parameter name
        Returns:
        True if the parameter is defined in the MIB for the given sequence. False otherwise

      • checkParameter

        public boolean checkParameter(Parameter param)
        Check if the representation and radix of a parameter is the same as defined in the MIB
        Parameters:
        param - Parameter to be checked
        Returns:
        True if the parameter representation and radix are the same as defined in the MIB
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the representation or radix are different. The message in the exception will actually say what is the problem

      • getDefaultParameter

        public Parameter getDefaultParameter(java.lang.String parameterName)
        Get the default Parameter definition in the MIB for a parameter name
        Parameters:
        parameterName - The parameter name
        Returns:
        The parameter as default definition in the MIB

      • getMib

        public static Mib getMib()
        Get the MIB. It will try first to read the MIB form files, from the location defined in the properties. Then it will try to read it form the jar files in the class path. If it fails as well, the it will crate an empty MIB.
        Returns:
        the MIB
